keyMoments.title: Shoujou's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Shoujou appears with his ship and crew, using his specialized sonar equipment to search the ocean floor around Jaya.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of a key member of the Saruyama Alliance who will become an important ally to the Straw Hats.

keyMoments.title: Search Sonar Demonstration
keyMoments.description: Shoujou demonstrates his unique Search Sonar ability, using sound waves to map the ocean floor.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Shoujou's role as the 'Sonar King' and showcases his specialized salvage abilities.

keyMoments.title: Havoc Sonar Attack
keyMoments.description: Shoujou unleashes his devastating Havoc Sonar attack using his microphone, though it damages his own ship more than the enemy.
keyMoments.significance: First display of Shoujou's combat abilities and the destructive power of his sonic attacks.

abilities.description: Shoujou sends sound waves from his ship to the water below via a microphone. His Utan Divers listen for echoes to identify and locate underwater objects in a wide radius.
Shoujou uses his voice to make a special noise into his microphone that sends out destructive sound waves causing pain and damage to everything nearby.

relationships.description: Shoujou and Masira are sworn brothers who work together in the Saruyama Alliance.

evolutionMoments.description: Shoujou attacks the Straw Hats to avenge his brother Masira who was defeated by them.

relationships.description: Shoujou follows Mont Blanc Cricket as part of the Saruyama Alliance.

reveals.information: Master of sonar-based techniques for underwater exploration and combat
Sworn brother of Masira the salvage monkey
Head of underwater sonar operations around Jaya's coast

name.japanese: マーシャル・D・ティーチ

keyMoments.title: Dreams Never End Speech
keyMoments.description: Blackbeard delivers his iconic speech to Luffy and Zoro about how people's dreams never end, encouraging them to pursue their ambitions despite mockery.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most iconic philosophical moments in One Piece that encapsulates the series' central theme. Establishes Blackbeard's complex character as someone who shares Luffy's values about dreams despite being destined to be his enemy.

keyMoments.title: Luffy and Zoro Sense Plurality
keyMoments.description: After Blackbeard leaves, Luffy and Zoro remark 'It's not him, it's them,' sensing something unusual about Blackbeard's nature.
keyMoments.significance: Foreshadows mysteries about Blackbeard's unique physiology or soul that will be explored later. Has spawned countless fan theories about multiple souls or personalities.

reveals.information: Believes strongly in the power and eternity of dreams, encouraging others to pursue their ambitions
Luffy and Zoro sense something plural or unusual about his nature ('It's not him, it's them')

keyMoments.title: Refuses to Fight Bellamy
keyMoments.description: Luffy endures a brutal beating from Bellamy without fighting back, demonstrating maturity and confidence in his dreams.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy's character growth and understanding that some people aren't worth fighting. Demonstrates that true strength sometimes means restraint.

keyMoments.title: Senses Blackbeard's Plurality
keyMoments.description: Luffy senses something unusual about Blackbeard, remarking 'It's not him, it's them' after their encounter.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's heightened instincts and foreshadows mysteries about Blackbeard's true nature.

reveals.information: Shows maturity by refusing to fight those who mock his dreams, understanding that some conflicts aren't worth engaging in

keyMoments.title: Refuses to Fight Bellamy
keyMoments.description: Zoro endures the beating alongside Luffy, understanding and supporting Luffy's decision not to fight back.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's growth and his deep understanding of Luffy's mindset. Shows wisdom in knowing when not to draw his swords.
keyMoments.quote: They weren't standing in our way, you know.

keyMoments.title: Senses Blackbeard's Plurality
keyMoments.description: Zoro senses something unusual about Blackbeard along with Luffy, noting the plural nature of his presence.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Zoro's heightened perception and instincts that match Luffy's.

reveals.information: Articulates the wisdom of not fighting those who aren't standing in their way, showing strategic thinking
